description: This file defines a React component class 'ErrorBoundary' that provides error handling for React components by catching runtime errors, showing a fallback UI, and logging errors to the console.

classes.name: ErrorBoundary
classes.description: A React component class that catches runtime errors in its child components, displays a fallback UI, and logs errors to the console.

methods.name: constructor
methods.description: Initializes the ErrorBoundary with default state.

methods.name: getDerivedStateFromError
methods.description: Static method that updates state to indicate an error has occurred when an error is caught.

methods.name: componentDidCatch
methods.description: Lifecycle method that logs errors and info when an error is caught.

methods.name: render
methods.description: Renders fallback UI if an error was caught, otherwise renders child components.
